c74object.name: fl.timestddev~
c74object.digest: Calculates the standard deviation per sample over the most recent frames.
c74object.description: The output is the same length as the input. Input frames are expected to be of a uniform length. If the input length changes then the internal storage is reset. The object can also be reset by sending a frame to the reset input. The start parameter controls behaviour when insufficient frames are stored. The underlength output indicates that insufficient frames are stored.

entry.name: 1. /max_frames [int]
entry.description:
Sets the maximum number of frames for calculation.
Note that the internal buffer is reset when this changes.

entry.name: 2. /num_frames [int]
entry.description: Sets the current number of frames for calculation as an integer.

entry.name: 4. /start [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the behaviour when there are insufficient frames stored (as after a reset):
pad - pad the calculation with default values to account for the missing frames.
shorten - calculate on all frames received since the reset.
Note that frames at the reset input set the frame use for padding.
If the frame is too short or empty it is padded with the pad parameter.
[0] - pad [1] - shorten
